fields.description:
Staging hunks in large files has become a serious chore. If I'm only staging one hunk, no worries, but the more I stage, the more time the pane refreshes, loads, and waits. It's really frustrating when it continuously re-selects the staged version of the file, rather than the unstaged that I've just intentionally manually selected.

I've recorded a video of my interaction with it, which is typical of my usual workflow, including the frustration with staging. It's affecting how I work, to the point where I do it less to avoid the frustration until the end and batch it all up to the end.

_File upload limit is 10MB so I have uploaded this 22MB video elsewhere._
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1fbfKCwZQROllgJYxnyqsV8S7tAXrNf0f/view?usp=sharing

When watching the video, pay careful attention to the cursor movement and clicks. Please review the entire video. The cursor reveals my intent and attempts to anticipate the unexpected/undesired re-selection, and fails.

This Sourcetree behavior is exceedingly frustrating, especially when working with many large files.

Please leave a comment if you have any questions or need anything clarified.
fields.summary: Excessive Staging Churn

fields.description: Attached is a screen shot of the result of the bug. I had just pressed the Push button when I got this error message. The error message was displayed about the same time the SourceTree screen collapsed (see upper, left of screen).
fields.summary: Constraint error resulting in collapsing window

fields.description:
Sometimes the File Status Workspace will show the Light Theme when it's in the blank state.

When pending changes are present, the Dark Theme somewhat comes back but not completely.

The only "fix" right now is to toggle themes in Preferences > General.
fields.summary: Dark Theme Show Light Theme Workspace

fields.description: When I upgraded from 2.1.5 to 2.3.5 'sourcetree:' protocol handler wasn't updated in the registry so I had to manually update it to point to the new location.
fields.summary: [Duplicate] Protocol handler doesn't get updated

fields.description: When I upgraded from 2.1.5 to 2.3.5 'sourcetree:' protocol handler wasn't updated in the registry so I had to manually update it to point to the new location.
fields.summary: [Duplicate] Protocol handler doesn't get updated

fields.description: When I upgraded from 2.1.5 to 2.3.5 'sourcetree:' protocol handler wasn't updated in the registry so I had to manually update it to point to the new location.
fields.summary: [Duplicate] Protocol handler doesn't get updated

fields.description: When I upgraded from 2.1.5 to 2.3.5 'sourcetree:' protocol handler wasn't updated in the registry so I had to manually update it to point to the new location.
fields.summary: [Duplicate] Protocol handler doesn't get updated

fields.description:
Please consider enhancing the repository browser window to support repo "groups" (folders).

I have repos listed for my 1. own personal projects; B. for my own company's projects; and iii. for my full-time work projects, all intermingled in a big mess.  It'd be awesome to be able to segregate the various projects by their different "work contexts".
fields.summary: Groups in repo browser

fields.description:
Please consider enhancing the repository browser window to support repo "groups" (folders).

I have repos listed for my 1. own personal projects; B. for my own company's projects; and iii. for my full-time work projects, all intermingled in a big mess.  It'd be awesome to be able to segregate the various projects by their different "work contexts".
fields.summary: Groups in repo browser

fields.description:
On a particular project, I have some files which have huge diff changes, e.g. the pack-lock.json.

If I click on one of these by accident, it will start trying to show the diff which will freeze the whole app.

But even more inconvenient is if I open Sourcetree and it happens to have the focus on this large file on open of the project, it freezes straight away and there's nothing I can do except to git reset that file in terminal.

Have attached a video of the behaviour...

It would be awesome to be able to hit escape and that would stop the diff !ezgif-1-1dfbc8f651 2.gif!!ezgif-1-1dfbc8f651 2.gif!  attempt.
fields.summary: Ability to cancel diff of large file

fields.description:
Add an action to reverse all changes from a given file while viewing a commit or comparison.

There are actions for reversing lines, hunks and commits. There should also be one for files.
fields.summary: Reverse file

fields.description:
Reversing changes disrupts your current comparison.

 

To reproduce:
 # Clean your working copy, so there are no uncommitted changes
 # View comparison between two commits in repository
 # Select one of the files with changes
 # Click “Reverse hunk” button in diff view

 

After reversing the changes, the entire UI flashes and removes you from your comparison.
fields.summary: Reversing changes disrupts comparison

fields.description:
Reversing changes disrupts your current comparison.

 

To reproduce:
 # Clean your working copy, so there are no uncommitted changes
 # View comparison between two commits in repository
 # Select one of the files with changes
 # Click “Reverse hunk” button in diff view

 

After reversing the changes, the entire UI flashes and removes you from your comparison.
fields.summary: Reversing changes disrupts comparison

fields.description:
The automatic refresh features, “Refresh automatically when files change”, and “Check default remotes for updates every X minutes”, are very disruptive. They cause so many problems for me that I always disable them.

These activities should occur silently in the background and not interrupt your work at all—not change your selections, not scroll your views—nothing.
fields.summary: Automatic refreshing should not interrupt your work

fields.description:
*PLEASE DO NOT* irreversibly delete files when I press Cmd-Delete while typing in a text field. This is a standard macOS text editing keystroke. When typing in a text fields on macOS, Cmd-Delete is the standard key combo for deleting text between the cursor and the beginning of the line. It should not be overridden to delete your files. 

Almost every time I edit a commit message in SourceTree, I inevitably hit this key combo at some point and this scary message pops up: “*Confirm Remove Modified or Untracked Files?* The following files contain changes or information which is not in source control, and will be irretrievably lost if you remove them”
fields.summary: Cmd-Delete should not irreversibly delete files when typing in a text field

fields.description:
When viewing differences between two commits, the diff view of renamed files does not work.

The list of changed files correctly shows that a file has been renamed. However, when you select it, the diff view instead tells you that the entire file is new. You can only see the new version of the file, not the diff with the original.
fields.summary: Cannot view differences in a renamed file

fields.description:
It can be extremely difficult to view differences between two commits in a large repository when those commits are very far apart in time.

As far as I can tell, the only way to view differences between commits is to select the first commit, then locate the second commit and shift-click on it. Unfortunately, almost all methods for locating that second commit (jump to, selecting branch/tag from sidebar, clicking parent links, etc.) will remove the selection from the first commit. The only way it works is if you restrict yourself to locating the second commit by carefully scrolling through the repo without clicking on *anything* else. All that scrolling can be extremely tedious in a large repository.

There should be a better way to select the two commits you want to compare that allows you to use all the normal search tools without losing your initial selection: perhaps a special “select for comparison” action that maintains your initial selection separate from the normal selection.
fields.summary: Very difficult to view diff between distant commits in large repository

fields.description:
When attempting to view differences between an old commit in the repository and the current working copy, the diff view on the right is always blank.

The list of files with differences on the left is correct, but selecting any of them has no effect.

Viewing differences between two commits works fine.
fields.summary: Diff view always blank when comparing with working copy

fields.description:
My issue is that pre-push hook is working well when push is made by CLI but it does not when SourceTree is making the push.

 

SourceTree: 2.6.3 (134)

SystemGit: 2.13.6

 

{{Hook}}
{code:java}
#!/bin/zsh# variables
gifName=$(date +%H-%M-%S\ %d-%m-%y)
gifFolderName="Gifs"
gifDir="$gifFolderName"# create video
videosnap -t 5 -p 'Low' --no-audio -w 0
# convert to gif
gifify -o newGif movie.mov
rm movie.mov
if [ ! -d $gifDir ]; then
mkdir $gifDir
fi
mv newGif.gif "$gifDir/$gifName.gif"
{code}
 

 

{{CLI output}}
{code:java}
~/Projects/setup master ⇡
❯ git push 
Started capture...Captured 4.93 seconds of video to 'movie.mov'
newGif.gif
Counting objects: 3, done.
Delta compression using up to 4 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (2/2), done.
Writing objects: 100% (3/3), 287 bytes | 287.00 KiB/s, done.
Total 3 (delta 1), reused 0 (delta 0)
To ssh://my.repo:/home/user/repo/git/priv/setup
01056a6..fe41aee master -> master~/Projects/setup master 9s
❯
{code}
 

SourceTree output
{code:java}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree push -v --tags origin refs/heads/master:refs/heads/master
Pushing to ssh://my.repo:/home/user/repo/git/priv/setup
.git/hooks/pre-push:15: command not found: videosnap
.git/hooks/pre-push:17: command not found: gifify
rm: movie.mov: No such file or directory
mv: rename newGif.gif to Gifs/10-33-56 14-11-17.gif: No such file or directory
error: failed to push some refs to 'ssh://my.repo:/home/user/repo/git/priv/setup'
Completed with errors, see above
{code}
fields.summary: pre-push hook's tools are not accessible through SourceTree but work in CLI

fields.description:
Hello com,
 * Start ST w/o login,
 * press *[CMD+,]* for settings.
 * Settings window opens modal, but behind main/login window. (so its not clickable)
 * So before being logged in, I could neither change settings nor look up version by GUI.
 * I've got my ST version by the downloaded "installer" which was named "xxx-2.6.3a". (Dunno if updated automatically on application startup)
 * Now I started creating this ticket, noticing that there is no version 2.6.3 in Jira
fields.summary: Cannot login with latest 2.6.3a client

fields.description: The highlighted item's default foreground color is white and is not changed into black when the item is being renamed. So... the foreground color is overlapped as the background color.
fields.summary: The rename input box of highlighted item in repository browser is not visible

fields.description: The auto refresh is so annoying because it always jumps back to the top, when you have a long list of files you check the wrong ones because of this behavior
fields.summary: Please make it possible to switch off the automatic list refresh when selecting files to be committed

fields.description:
As described here:

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Unable-to-quot-Reset-quot-multiple-files/qaq-p/668395?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=accept_as_solution_reminder&utm_content=topic]

 

Option "Reset all" is not available when both new and modified files are selected. It would be so useful to have it when we want to "discard all changes". Currently we have to manually select only modified files on the list, which is tedious when the list is long.
fields.summary: Enable "Reset all" option when both new and modified files are selected
Enable "Reset all" option when both new and modified files are selected

fields.description:
DE - EN translation error:

Translations are not consistent (Clone, Klon),

Spelling error: Klone -> should be "Klonen"

!image-2017-11-10-11-46-53-301.png!
fields.summary: Translation Error: Clone

fields.description: Attached screen shot displays date formatted in Japanese while selected Language is "English(U.S.)" and  System Language is "Japanese".
fields.summary: Relative date in commit history is formatted in System language instead of selected Language in Preferences.

fields.description:
Double-clicked a remote repo and whoopsie

Crashlog attached
fields.summary: Crash trying to open a remote GitHub repo

fields.description:
I encountered the new Build Status Column in the beta, and because it wasn't relevant to my current project I wanted to turn it off. The column wasn't labeled, with a header or tooltip text, so I didn't know what it was even called, until I posted in the beta forum and learned its name.

If tooltip text on column-header-hover could have revealed that that column is called "Build Status", that would have been one good step, but better than that, a contextual popup menu when right-clicking that column header could say "Hide Build Status Column". I intuitively attempted both of these to resolve my issue myself, with no luck.

There is a more elaborate and complete solution which is to include a "Columns" sub-menu in the View menu, which lets you check on and off any columns you'd like. With this approach, you wouldn't need to literally label the Build Status column itself, because it would already be categorized and named by this submenu. This could be very useful, as I've also historically wanted to turn off the Commit hash column since it's just visual clutter for me and if I need the hash, I can simply right-click the column and copy it from there (a great feature).

Some UX to consider. Thanks.
fields.summary: BETA: Hiding the Build Status Column

fields.description: Sometimes when I click on "History" sidebar item after commit the details view refuses to switch from "File status" to "History" (screenshot attached). I have to click back on "File status" and then "History" to really switch it.
fields.summary: Sidebar doesn't switch detail view at times

fields.description: Clicking on View -> Hide Sidebar crashes 100% (logs attached)
fields.summary: Hiding sidebar crashes

fields.description:
Occasionally, when attempting to resolve a merge conflict in a git repo in Sourcetree via the diff pane, after a brief wait, the merge conflict is not resolved.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a merge conflict.

2. Right click a file in the diff pane, choose Resolve conflicts -> resolve using theirs (can't be sure I've tested using "mine").

3. Occasionally, the Sourcetree client pauses for a moment like it's resolving the conflict, but no action appears to have been taken. 

4. Repeating step 2 will more often than not correctly resolve the merge conflict.

I can't reliably reproduce what causes this to sometimes fail silently and sometimes work as intended.

Cheers.
fields.summary: Resolving merge conflict sometimes fails silently

fields.description:
I would like to have a compact view option. In short, I think the new view is too spaced out.

In other words, each row should take less vertical space, more like the 2.6 view.

If I could choose compact versus loose display, I would choose compact every time.

Perhaps it could be a theme.
fields.summary: Compact history display option

fields.description: Crashes nearly every day. Sometimes more. Sometimes less. Often in the background.
fields.summary: Crashing daily

fields.description:
The Dark theme of SourceTree is OK until you have turned on the "Reduced transparency" option under Accessibility in System Preferences. See attached screenshot.

Paradoxically using that "accessibility" option makes the SourceTree more inaccessible.
fields.summary: Dark theme with Reduced transparency looks terrible

fields.description:
When merging and resolving conflicts I right clicked on a conflicted file and used Resolve using their option. SourceTree however didn't keep non conflicted changes. Is this a bug or a feature? I was expecting way different results. Also that operation isn't shown in command history, so I ca't check what git command are used to this. When using standard
`git merge -Xtheirs` option I've different results.
fields.summary: Resolve using Theirs don't keep non conflicted changes.

fields.description: The Repository Browser window displays branch names next to each repository, but the branch name is not updated when I change branch both from SourceTree UI and from the command line. The only way to have the branch name updated seems to be manually resizing the window.
fields.summary: Repository Explorer Window - branch names not updating

fields.description:

fields.summary: Unable to unshelve when there are file deletions in the shelve

fields.description: 10 entries may be enough for some, but I work with close to 20 repos daily. Switching using "Open Recent" is faster than opening the Repository Browser.
fields.summary: Increase number of recents in File->Open Recent

fields.description:
I start SourceStree opens some Git windows and arrange them in a single, multi-tab one.

Then I close SourceTree.

When I start it again, all windows are opened separately.

I've also tried to set the "Prefer tabs when opening document" system preference to "Always" (a configuration that I don't like at all) just to see if something changes, and now all windows open as tabs, but the tabs' order is not the one I had when I closed the application.
fields.summary: SourceTree doesn't re-open previously organized tabs
Russian localization bug

fields.description: In version 2.13 (Q2 2017) Git introduced the ability to stash a single file instead of all changed files. This is a feature that I would love to see in the embedded version of Git in Sourcetree.
fields.summary: As a dev I would like to be able to stash a single file

fields.description: When I rename the selected project (so the project is shown as white text on a blue background), when I rename, the text box appears white, but the text remains white, so it is unreadable unless it is selected.
fields.summary: Renaming a Local Repository results in unreadable text.

fields.description: When working with large diffs (mostly package-lock.json and yarn.lock) the UI hangs sometimes for multiple seconds. But it should either not show large diffs by default (like the web ui) or load them in an asynchronous fashion to unblock the main UI. while loading the diff one can't switch away from the big file.
fields.summary: Working with big files freezes UI

fields.description: SourceTree should recognise GnuPG that was installed via Homebrew on macOS out of the box and not only GPG Tools.
fields.summary: Support for Homebrew's gnupg
Ability to disable bounce icon in dock from settings

fields.description:
I choose SourceTree > Check for Updates. I get this error:

Update Error!
Sourcetree can’t be updated when it’s running from a read-only volume like a disk image or an optical drive. Move Sourcetree to Applications folder using Finder, relaunch it from there, and try again.

SourceTree is not _on_ a read-only volume; it’s in my Applications folder. I copied it there in the normal way. It’s writable.

Workaround: go to the SourceTree homepage and look for updates by hand.
fields.summary: Attempting to update produces an incorrect error message about read-only volume

fields.description:
After files changes numbers in round labels in repos list on the right side are not being refreshed, only app restart helps.

It has begun after upgrade to High Sierra (10.13)
fields.summary: File status counter in repositories list not updating

fields.description: As in "Finish release" dialog, it would be great if we could Push changes to remote on a feature which is going to be finished. It will remove origin/feature branch automatically if exists, as Finish release does.
fields.summary: Add "Push changes to remote" in "Finish feature" dialog

fields.description: After I installed macOS High Sierra, Sourcetree cannot keep track of my settings. It even forgets the window size, the toolbar elements and everything. I removed completely (delete the app and all the files/folders from ~/Library) and then installed it again. For a day it was working and after 2 restarts it started to forget everything again.
fields.summary: macOS High Sierra (10.13) preferences

fields.description: After the recent update my files do not appear as committed in the Sourcetree interface after I have committed them. I continue to have darkened icons even after a commit (indicating a non-committed file) that only resolves when I quit the application, and re-open. This is a nuisance only in that I work on a lot of different files throughout the day and it is becoming confusing which files are and are not committed and it shouldn't be a necessity to constantly reopen or refresh the app. Please advise, thank you!
fields.summary: SourceTree UI doesn't update commit icon

fields.description:
When left running, often overnight, but sometimes randomly during the day, SourceTree will crash and need to be restarted.   Most recent crashlog is attached, please advise if there is any additional info that I can provide to help find the cause.

I have never lost any data as a result of any of the crashes, it's mostly an annoyance.
fields.summary: SourceTree 2.6.3 (134) for Mac often crashes overnight.

fields.description: I tried to install sourcetree on my new mac. it tells me that my curent password is wrong and the forgot my password link show only a json output but never changes my password
fields.summary: Cannot change password

fields.description:
Working the JIRA suite we follow a simple rule of having issue key in the commit message template. There are few ways of having git prepare-msg hook and commit-msg hook that can append the current branch name (being the issue key) in but it's not very user friendly.

Would it be all impossible to have a *variables* inside the SourceTree settings, where commit message is? Same way there are *variables* for custom actions in SourceTree preferences.

This way, it would be possible to have custom commit message template as:

 

```
$BRANCH - 
```

Other variables that could be used apart from `$BRANCH` would be any variables from git itself ec.
fields.summary: Commit Message Template Variables

fields.description: Please, add branch names on mouse hover on branches graphs. Currently, it's not very intuitive and hard to distinguish which branch is red, orange and blue.
fields.summary: Display branch names on mouse hover

fields.description:
I tried to load an Hgh repository of mine: [https://bitbucket.org/thomthom/quadface-tools/overview]

 

At first I get an series of Unsupported HgAttic Shelves. (The "Lean more" button leads to a 404 btw. And I find no "Shelves - HgAttic" menu...). After clicking through them (Why so many?) I'm presented with the view of that repo.

 

But as soon as I try to interact with the left sidebar, fold/unfold, scroll etc, SourceTree crashes.

I submitted the BugSplat report.

 

I also tried with a different Hg repository I have. That did not crash. So it appear to be something with that one I linked above.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes with Hg repository

fields.description: Custom actions in settings and context menus can't be suitable reordered.
fields.summary: Can't reorder custom actions in settings

fields.description:
After moving the SourceTree window from a normal laptop-sized screen to a vertical oriented screen and then resizing the window to fit the new vertical monitor, the interior "changes" pane, listing staged & unstaged files + diffs, is tiny and basically useless.

To workaround I must resize the "changes" pane.

Impact is UX pain - that I must resize the changes pane every day when I plug my laptop into my desktop area with the monitors. Also I must use the very small grab-bar which separates the commit log from the "changes" pane.

See the screenshot for an illustration of the default layout, before I workaround it.

I would expect for SourceTree to provide a Reasonable amount of sizing to this "changes" view, at the bottom of the screen. Like maybe 1/4 of the total "Y" space, currently taken up by the change-log and not 1/20th.
fields.summary: Interior "Changes" pane shrunken to 1/20th after moving window to vertical monitor

fields.description:
I've noticed that since the last upgrade (to 2.6.3) Sourcetree gradually degrades in performance as I use it throughout the day, eventually reaching a point where it becomes intolerable. After restarting, it responds fine and snappy, but performance eventually drops again. I'm not working with particularly many repositories, nor are they very large. The degradation happens consistently, but I can't pinpoint any particular actions that cause it, just through general use.

Activity Monitor suggests this is due to a memory leak. After restarting Sourcetree it indicates memory usage ~100MB. When I check Activity Monitor as performance begins to noticeably drop, the memory usage is in the GB range (1.5 GB). It gets worse (I've seen it exceed 4GB) until I restart it.
fields.summary: Memory leak leading to degraded performance

fields.description:
Performing any action with big repo, like [JetBrains one|[https://github.com/JetBrains/intellij-community.git],] results in dramatically performance dropdown and apps hanging.

App hangs for few minutes (up to 10 minutes of 'App Not Responding' message in Activity Monitor) on every single action: opening repository view, pulling of new commits from remote branch, opening any commits details, etc.
fields.summary: Performance on big repositories drops dramatically

fields.description:
Performing any action with big repo, like [JetBrains one|[https://github.com/JetBrains/intellij-community.git],] results in dramatically performance dropdown and apps hanging.

App hangs for few minutes (up to 10 minutes of 'App Not Responding' message in Activity Monitor) on every single action: opening repository view, pulling of new commits from remote branch, opening any commits details, etc.
fields.summary: Performance on big repositories drops dramatically
UI not refreshing after custom action

fields.description:
SourceTree is asking for password on every push to remote. The box for adding to keychain is ticked. The dialogue box asks for the password "For user git on host github.com" for example, but that isn't very clear as it wants the password to the SSH key you've registered with github. After entering the password, it works. But it asks on every push/pull. 

I tried removing the accounts and re-adding. No result.

I tried deleting the keychain items in keychain app. It asked me to Allow access to keychain. But again, no result regarding asking for password.

I am really struggling with SourceTree now regarding user authorisation, as last week I also had to reset all my ssh keys (not for the first time) and it does make me wonder what OAuth actually does....
fields.summary: Keeps asking for password (but ALSO it's asking for wrong password)

fields.description: Please provide a keyboard shortcut for changing the branch just like pull where we can select branch from locally available branches
fields.summary: Shortcut for changiung branch

fields.description:
The title says already. Sourcetree is unable to clone from external repos that dont have the ending ".git"

Example:

Works: [https://example.ch/esrlabs/git-repo.git|https://github.com/esrlabs/git-repo.git]

Works not: [https://example.ch/esrlabs/git-repo|https://github.com/esrlabs/git-repo]

I testet that with the offical github client and git kraken worked like a charme. So for me this is a bug duo that our repo's all have none ".git" ending i cant use Sourcetree.
fields.summary: Unable to clone from external URL without the ending ".git"

fields.description: The files changed count is not updated in the repository browser window after commit/push from opened repo details window. Repo browser window is on laptop display. If drag repo browser window to external monitor then files changed count updates.
fields.summary: Repository Browser Files Changed Count Not Updated Multiple Monitors

fields.description:
I was using sourcetree to access my github account with ssh keys. My key was set up in accounts and was uploaded to github. 

On the 10th of October - 6 days ago - I changed the keys on Github. Since that, I did not quit the program or restarted the mac, and I was still able to access my Github account with the old ssh key stored in Sourcetree. When today I restarted the mac, I was getting access denied messages because of the public key. I changed to the new key in sourcetree and now it's working fine. 

How was it able to still connect with the old key?
fields.summary: Security issue - user can access github account after changing the keys

fields.description:
It is hard to distinguish between the gray clickable and nonclickable commit button in the dark theme.

The blue button theme that is present on other screens would make sense when it's clickable.
fields.summary: Indistinguishable gray commit button in dark theme
Can't log in

fields.description:
Hi ,

    Recently, I got a pop up to update Source Tree and I did update it to 2.3.1. Now, I am not able to push code. It keeps complaining on Authentication Failure. The credentials are correct because I can log in using terminal (git bash) and through browser.Can you please suggest a version I can update to , to get rid of the issue ?
fields.summary: Authetication failure when pushing code

fields.description:
When adding new repositories, and using scan directory, if the directory has a .git folder, it doesn't scan sub-folders.

The expected behavior would be for the project list to show with the root folder (the selected folder) as first, and then all subfolders with repos to show after.

It looks like scan stops at some discretionary points (ex. in this case, stops at root folder, but on folders with projects with PHP / Composer in vendor folder, it still shows all the vendor folder modules as repos to add).
fields.summary: Scan directory doesn't scan directory

fields.description: Initial set up does not allow me to log in to my existing account. There are several bugs on your form validation. When I type my email address, validation continues to ask for a valid email. If I go through to "can't log in" and then return to log in then sometimes email is accepted but then I encounter the same problem on entering password. I tried instead to set up an new account, this works but when connecting to my github account, I log in but then go back to the screen for connecting my accounts and it doesn't allow me to go to the next step.
fields.summary: Setup login doesn't work

fields.description:
Like to have support for "custom action" on a branch (like like today on $FILE/$REPO/$SHA)

This to introduce $BRANCH

So I can right click the branch/tag in the browser under either "Branch/TAGS/Remote" tree and run that action in the context menu.
fields.summary: Allow custom action to be run on branch

fields.description: I would like the ability to tag a commit from within the commit window, so I can auto push (the tag and commit) at once.
fields.summary: Allow tag creation in commit

fields.description: We have a project in Stash server (local install, not Atlassian hosted) that I have previously cloned. I want to check out a branch, so in my browser, I click the Clone in SourceTree button. The OS directs this request over to SourceTree, which brings up the Open Existing dialog, as expected. It correctly shows my existing clones of that project, so I choose one and click Open. At this point, nothing happens. I don’t get a progress dialog, an error dialog, or indeed any indication that I did anything at all.
fields.summary: SourceTree doesn’t check out branches using Stash integration

fields.description: When running SourceTree in a screen sharing session I cannot expand sidebar sections and hence cannot e.g. unstash something. When hovering with the mouse over the expand/collapse labels they are with some flickering, but don't do anything on click (except to disappear, but that can also be the result of moving the mouse slightly).
fields.summary: Cannot expand/collapse left sidebar sections when running on screen sharing

fields.description: File status -> resize dividers by sliding right most divider to the right.
fields.summary: File status resize dividers cause unusual behavior when sliding right most divider to the right.

fields.description:
I’d like to be able to browse all the files in a git repository as they exist at a given commit.

Use cases:
• I added a new file to branch A. I want to add that file to branch B.
• I want to see how a file changed between commit C and D, so I want to extract the individual files to a separate location (Save As… dialog). Note that the file did not necessarily change in either C or D.
• Like the previous one, but maybe a whole folder of files.
• I want to run blame on a specific file.
• And many more.

From the command line, I can use one of the many increasingly prolific variants of `git checkout` to do the first two (not sure if it handles folders). I don’t think SourceTree has a way to browse or perform commands on arbitrary files in a repository. I think the best answer is to browse through the commit history until you happen to find the right file.
fields.summary: Support browsing of commits and checkout of individual files

fields.description: It would be really nice for SourceTree to support git bisect. I’m not sure how much of a pain it would be to design a UI for it, but you already handle merging with conflict resolution, so I suspect you could figure out some way to make it function.
fields.summary: Support git bisect

fields.description:
As I try to install the new version of source tree, when I open the setup, the screen to accept the terms and conditions doesn't work. I Check the "I agree with the terms..." checkbox but the "Continue" Button keeps greyed out, therefore I cannot proceed the installation. 

 

Source tree was working fine until this update appeared... I believe it automatically updated and broke everything right in the middle of my sprint... (running away from my manager)
fields.summary: Can't Install Source Tree Greyed "Continue" Button

fields.description:
The inconsistency due to recent rebranding from *SourceTree* to *Sourcetree* really drives me crazy.  If nobody cares about *T* vs *t* then why would it even bother to use Git or any other VCS, right?
 # Yeah I get it - it's now "Sourcetree" and I'm fine:
!01.png|thumbnail!
 # Jira:
!02.png|thumbnail!
 # Dock:
!03.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Sourcetree or SourceTree, that's a question

fields.description:
After files changes numbers in round labels in repos list on the right side are not being refreshed, only app restart helps.

It has begun after upgrade to High Sierra (10.13)
fields.summary: File status counter in repositories list not updating

fields.description:
White font colour in "Repository group name " field while editing

!Снимок экрана 2017-10-10 в 10.25.21.png|width=391,height=95!

!Снимок экрана 2017-10-10 в 10.25.11.png!
fields.summary: White font colour in "Repository group name " field while editing

fields.description:
Diffing of large files should NOT freeze the entire application.  PLEASE calculate diffs on a seperate thread - then large file diffs would be fine.  

Bonus points if you show a progress bar on diff processing on large files.
fields.summary: Diff views should not be calculated in the UI thread.

fields.description:
In the repository browser, the current status of the repos isn't very fresh anymore. The count of local changes un-committed yet; the count of remote commits ahead/behind - these badges in the UI don't refresh as fast as they used to. 

Cmd-R doesn't seem to trigger a refresh.

The gear menu says "Refresh Avatars". Is this what we're talking about?  Why "avatar"?  Aren't these "repos" or maybe "bookmarks"?

 

Anyway, refresh not working anymore. In prior versions, cmd-r had an effect. No more.
fields.summary: Sourcetree browser refresh unresponsive

fields.description:
There's a very annoying problem in Source Tree which turns the applcation unusable since the last UI change.

Every time I click on a commit in commits list the Diff view starts to proccess freezing the application until it's ready.

Not every time I open Source Tree I really want to view Diffs, sometimes I just want to pull changes or create branches.

In fact, I use the Diff View less times than other features in the app.

An option to hide the diff view and only open when needed will resolve this issue.

There's a ticket opened since 2014 (3 years!!!) about this.

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Questions/SourceTree-Is-there-any-way-to-turn-off-file-preview-diff-on-a/qaq-p/266006

I tried to use the Max File Count 0 as pointed in the thread above but the application still try to render diffs.

I really enjoy Source Tree and use this since ever, but I'm starting to look for alternatives because my workflow are being compromised.
fields.summary: Option to hide Diff View

fields.description: SourceTree 2.6.3 keeps crashing in the background. Crash logs attached.
fields.summary: Keeps crashing in background

fields.description:
The git history looks like this:

x - commit 1
 
x - commit 2
 
x - commit 3
 
x - commit 4

 

When right clicking on commit 3 and selecting "Rebase children of *** interactively...", nothing happens. If I do the same but from commit 4, it shows the dialog.

If you tell me what git commands this UI command is doing I could try them manually and see what git tells me.

This happens in SourceTree 2.6.3, on Mac OS.

 

UPDATE: i think the problem is that three branches are using commit 3: branch1, origin/branch1 and branch2. When I removed branch2 the command succeeded.
fields.summary: Rebase children interactively is doing nothing

fields.description: If you are already viewing the repo window (say after committing you leave it open), and make file changes, upon viewing file status tab, it does not refresh to show the changes. You have to close the window and reopen the repo window.
fields.summary: File status does not refresh if window is already open
Please fix the problem where changes count keeps showing in mac screen even after pushing the code

fields.description:
The awesome black theme in Source Tree leaks a bit in terms of _recognizability_ of merge conflicted files at glance. The yellow icon is too similar (in terms of color) to the edited files.

This leads to bad recognizability on big merges.

Proposed fix: Make it red or more evident color on the black theme.
fields.summary: More evident icon for merge conflicts in black themes

fields.description:
I can't log in to the app.

I am _not_ copy and pasting

I click continue a million times and it never does

One time I somehow managed to continue, and then the same thing happened with my password.
fields.summary: Sourcetree does not detect email address

fields.description:
After the latest update (2.6.3), the repository browser no longer properly updates with the branch that you have switched to. So, if you have 3 repositories:

 

a.someproject (master checked out)

b.someproject (master checked out)

c.someproject (master checked out)

 

If you checkout 'branch-one' on c.someproject, the repository browser will still show 'master' next to c.someproject.
fields.summary: Repository Browser Does Not Update

fields.description:
In previous versions (I don't remember exactly which, maybe 2.4) I could maximize the Repository Browser Window.In current version the icon has changed and I cannot maximize using the + button.  

!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/6675i711FF989BCE27FB7/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!

Could you put back the maximize/minimize button for the Repository Browser as other windows?

!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/6676i1E1883C5F2271F54/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!   !https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/6677i8CAF8DDD497942F4/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!
fields.summary: Restore full screen mode for repository browser

fields.description:
The status icon showing the number of files with uncommitted changes does not get updated anymore. It does however display the correct information when I open Sourcetree. 

 

I have screenshots illustrating this, but I get the error message "JIRA could not attach the file as there was a missing token. Please try attaching the file again." when trying to attach them. (My network connection is definitely not the problem here.)
fields.summary: UI does not get refreshed after a commit
Installation issues

fields.description: there is a bug in first name text box.
fields.summary: validation failure

fields.description: Nothing to Commit screen does not match Dark theme
fields.summary: Dark Theme not on Nothing to Commit screen

fields.description:
Scenario:
 # Create a new branch
 # Make a commit
 # {{Cmd + Shift + P}} to push it
 # Inspect the "Push" dialog contents

Expected result:
 * the branch you're currently on has it's checkbox in "checked" state

Actual result:
 * One has to manually check the box
fields.summary: Have current branch pre-checked in the "push branch" dialog even if it does not have a corresponding remote branch

fields.description: Some Git GUI clients (like SmartGit, for example), make it really easy to maintain local changes and still do development as needed. In a nutshell, they allow you to make a {{pull}} even if your working tree has changed/added/deleted files. I think they do it via {{stash / stash pop}} and show a meaningful message if {{stash pop}} fails. That would be so much better than having to manually do this thing every time.
fields.summary: Allow `git pull` with non-clean working tree
